name: §c§nEnemy of Light
description: As an Origin that depends on the shadows to assassinate, the light ruins your opportunity to assassinate.

text: Unnatural light will weaken your Shadow Arts.
Receiving the §cGlowing§r effect will effect these skills:
You will also receive §c2.5x§r more damage and deal §c25%§r less damage while under the §cGlowing§r effect.
You will receive §c+2§r damage from Spectral Arrows.
Items that emit light can be detrimental to your Shadow Arts if used correctly.
Getting hit by any of the following:
Will apply the §cGlowing§r effect for §c30§r seconds.
Lightning is full of light and being near a bolt will be deadly to you.
You will take §c2x§r damage when struck by lightning.
If lightning strikes near you in a §c5§r block radius, you will be debuffed with §cWeakness III§r §ffor §c30 seconds§r §fand §cGlowing§r §ffor §c1§r §fminute.

Invisibility will also be cleared and will go immediately to the disabling threshold (§c400§r Detection) of §c§nLight Meter§r. Any lightning strikes afterward will increase the meter by §c+100§r Detection.
When there is too much exposure to the light, your Shadow Arts become disabled.
There is a meter that will do the following:
When staying on the disabling threshold and above (400 Detection or greater).
When hitting the max of the meter, you will receive the §cGlowing§r effect for §c1§r minute.
The meter will work as follows per tick (1/20 second):
§c- +1§r Detection While on a block with Light Level 10
§c- +2§r Detection While on a block with Light Level 11
§c- +3§r Detection While on a block with Light Level 12
§c- +4§r Detection While on a block with Light Level 13
§c- +5§r Detection While on a block with Light Level 14 or greater
While under the §cGlowing§r effect, the meter will not decrease.
Getting hit while under the §cGlowing§r effect will bring the meter to the disabling threshold (§c+400§r Detection), every hit afterwards will increment the meter by §c+20§r Detection.

Getting hit while on the disabling threshold or higher
will apply the §cGlowing§r effect for §c15§r seconds.
